Andreessen Horowitz’s Rising Influence Over Trump-Era AI Policy -

Silicon Valley’s richest venture capital firm emerges as a “lobbying juggernaut” for minimal AI regulation.

Silicon Valley’s richest venture capital firm emerges as a “lobbying juggernaut” for minimal AI regulation.

Emerging-Market Stocks Rise Anew as AI Spending Jitters Ease - Emerging-market stocks rose to the highest since Jan. 30 as investors bet the rally backed by artificial intelligence has more room to run.

Emerging-Market Stocks Rise Anew as AI Spending Jitters Ease - Emerging-market stocks rose to the highest since Jan. 30 as investors bet the rally backed by artificial intelligence has more room to run.
Alibaba, Tencent, and ByteDance Offer AI Red Packets to Lure Users - Vouchers and subsidies aim to boost subscriber numbers

Liberty Mutual to Partner With Net-Zero Focused PE Firm Ara - Liberty Mutual Group Inc.’s asset-management arm agreed to back Ara Partners’ infrastructure and energy strategies, in the latest partnership between an insurer and an alternative investment firm.

Alphabet kicks off its global bond spree with sterling and Swiss franc-denominated bonds for

Ferrari’s Confident Outlook Eases Investor Concerns Over Demand - Ferrari NV issued new guidance for 2026 that reassured investors about the luxury carmaker’s ability to sustain growth and margins through a major product transition.

Shooting Heard in Guinea Capital of Conakry, Agencies Report - Sustained gunshots were heard on Tuesday in the Guinean capital, Conakry, according to news agencies.

Bond Investors Are Betting on Another 100 Years of Google -

Alphabet’s sale of century bond is the first by a tech company since 1997.

SoFi Technologies Is Making Significant Moves in the Cryptocurrency Market. If History Repeats, Investors Can See Supercharged Returns. - This innovative fintech enterprise is going full steam ahead in the world of blockchain technology.

Spotify Sets User Growth Record After ‘Wrapped’ Promotion - Spotify Technology SA, the Swedish music streaming giant, added a record number of users last quarter, far surpassing Wall Street analyst expectations.

The metro area has some of America’s highest rates of institutional home ownership, and local governments are pushing back

Wall Street Firms Worked With Sanctioned Oligarch’s Family Trust - About six months after founding the New York hedge fund Mantle Ridge in 2016, Chief Executive Officer Paul Hilal flew to Moscow and pitched a potential investment to one of Russia’s richest men.

US Small-Business Optimism Eases on Economic Expectations - Sentiment among US small-business owners edged down in January for the first time in three months as optimism about the economic outlook eased.
Why Tech Is Obsessed With Moltbook, a Social Network for Bots - It’s like Reddit, but for bots.
AI’s Great Upheaval Is Coming for Governments - Investors and the voting public can only guess at the scale of the disruption ahead.

Russian Watchdog Starts Limiting Access to Telegram, RBC Reports - Russia’s communications watchdog, Roskomnadzor, plans to limit access to Telegram from Tuesday, the RBC news service reported, citing people familiar with the situation that it didn’t identify.

Anutin’s Core Cabinet Team Intact After ‘Blue Wave’ Thai Vote - For the first time in weeks, Thailand’s top cabinet ministers could breathe a sigh of relief as they gathered Tuesday at Government House in Bangkok.

Deutsche Bank Prefers US to Europe in Next 3 to 6 Months - Deutsche Bank strategist Maximilian Uleer explains his preference for US over European equities in the next three to six months. He speaks on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

CapVest Confirms Talks to Acquire European Energy Infra Firm TSG - CapVest Partners has entered into exclusive talks to acquire a majority stake in energy infrastructure firm TSG from private equity firm HLD.
Gilts Advance as Risk of Sudden Starmer Ousting Fades - UK borrowing costs dipped on Tuesday as Keir Starmer shored up his position as prime minister and the risk of a sudden leadership change faded.

US Bond Gains Leave Yields Close to Four-Week Low Ahead of Data - Treasuries are heading for a second straight day of gains ahead of US economic data and speeches from Federal Reserve officials that may reinforce the case for further interest-rate cuts.

Trump’s Grip on Billions of Taxpayer Dollars Loosened by Courts -

US judges have halted the administration’s cuts to funding in more than half of 167 spending fights in the past year

Tech Volatility Underscores Push to Diversify in US Stock Market - The tech sector’s once relentless push higher in the US stock market has turned into a topsy-turvy ride, forcing investors to seek calmer waters where stodgy, old-economy companies ply their trades.

India Seizes Three Tankers in First Action Against Dark Fleet - The Indian Coast Guard seized three tankers that it said were involved in oil smuggling, the first sign of the country getting tough on the so-called dark fleet.

Import Delays Halt Output at Some Indonesian Sugar Refiners - At least two Indonesian sugar refineries have been forced to halt production due to delays in receiving import permits from the government, according to people familiar with the matter.

Carlyle Acquires Majority Stake in India’s Nido Home Finance for $232 Million - Carlyle Group Inc. has agreed to acquire a majority stake in India’s Nido Home Finance Ltd. for about 21 billion rupees ($232 million).

Lars Windhorst Sued in US for Reneging on Bond Repurchase Deal - Lars Windhorst, the embattled German financier who has faced multiple lawsuits in recent years, was sued in the US for allegedly failing to repay millions of dollars in debts arising from a bond deal

BP Halts Share Buybacks to Shore Up Its Balance Sheet - BP is halting share buybacks to shore up its balance sheet as pressure mounts on the UK energy giant to deliver on its turnaround efforts. Bloomberg's Alaric Nightingale reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

BNP Backs Gold to Hit $6,000 an Ounce as Rally ‘Makes Sense’ - Gold may climb to $6,000 an ounce by the end of the year and bullion’s ratio to silver is set to rise as macroeconomic and geopolitical risks persist, BNP Paribas SA’s David Wilson said.

Costlier Cells from China Jolt Indian Solar Supply Chains - Surging prices of solar cells from China are rattling Indian module makers who depend on the neighboring nation for the essential component.

Turkey Says It Could Be Dragged Into Nuclear Arms Race Over Iran - Turkey would consider joining a regional nuclear arms race over concerns about Iran’s nuclear weapons ambitions, Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan said late Monday.

Greece and Malta Hesitate Over EU’s Russia Oil Services Ban - Greece and Malta have emerged as the main obstacle to a European Union proposal to replace a Russian oil price cap with a ban on the services needed to ship the fuel.

On today's show, a White House official says the exact date in April for US President Trump to meet with Chinese leader, Xi

South Africa Delays Hearing of DJ Linked to Russia War Recruiting - A South African court postponed the case against a state radio presenter accused of organizing the recruitment of people to fight for Russia against Ukraine for further investigation.

Egyptian Foie Gras-Seller Gourmet Surges in Trading Debut - Shares of premium grocer Gourmet Egypt SAE rose as much as 38% in their Egyptian stock exchange debut, in the country’s first initial public offering of the year.

Diamond Slump Spurs Botswana to Propose Raising Income Taxes - Botswana plans to raise corporate and personal taxes to offset a slump in diamond revenue and rein in a widening budget deficit.

PE Fund Harith in Talks to Buy South Africa’s Biggest Airline - South African private equity firm Harith General Partners plans to acquire budget carrier FlySafair as the investor with $3 billion in assets expands its transport portfolio on the continent.
Alphabet Begins Selling Multi Tranche Debut Swiss Franc Bond - Alphabet Inc. is selling Swiss franc-denominated bonds for the first time, following a bumper $20 billion deal in the US.
Alphabet Begins Selling Multi Tranche Debut Swiss Franc Bond - Alphabet Inc. is selling Swiss franc-denominated bonds for the first time, following a bumper $20 billion deal in the US.

China’s Bond Futures Positions Hit Record as Bullish Bets Surge - Chinese government bonds’ recent recovery is drawing more traders into derivatives, reflecting stronger demand for safety and hedging as confidence in the debt market grows.
